meanings.definition: A sudden loud noise or explosion.
meanings.sent2: I heard a blam from the fireworks outside.
meanings.sent3: The blam of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The blam of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The blam of the car crash echoed through the street.

meanings.definition: To criticize or blame someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Don't blam me for the mess!
meanings.sent2: She tends to blam others for her mistakes.
meanings.sent3: He likes to blam the dog for eating his homework.
meanings.sent4: She will blam the weather if her picnic gets ruined.
meanings.sent5: It's not fair to blam him without proof.

meanings.definition: A sound effect used in comic books to indicate a sudden impact.
meanings.sent1: The comic book had a blam when the hero punched the villain.
meanings.sent2: The blam in the comic made the action scene more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The blam in the comic made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: The blam in the comic felt like a real punch.
meanings.sent5: The blam in the comic was so loud it startled me.
